page.title: 08CALEDONIAN PINEWOODS:CANNICH
page.content:
{FORESTRY FARMING}IN CANNICH AREA:
The unique feature of the forest over which the Cannich forest office has control is the area of ancient {Caledonian Pinewoods}which total 1745 ha. in various blocks. A regime of {conservation}and regeneration of these native woodlands is well underway, the result of progressive operations over the last twenty years. The only rep- resentative of this forest within the 12 sq km area is a commemorative tree in the playing field at Cannich (Ref. NH 343314), a naturally regenerated seedling from the Caledonian Pinewood transplanted in 1977.
